name: felapton
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)

comment: "Felapton", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ph ` is ` ch ` , and some ` ph ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ps ` . Instance of ~ darapti . In Aristotelian notation, EAO-3: MeP and MaS therefore SoP. For example, "No flowers are animals" and "All flowers are plants", therefore "Some plants are not animals". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)
